79
80namespace cydui::events {
81 template<class T>
82 concept EventType = requires {
83 {
84 T::type
85 } -> std::convertible_to<str>;
86 typename T::DataType;
87 {
88 T::data
89 } -> std::convertible_to<typename T::DataType>;
90 {
91 T::DataType::win
92 } -> std::convertible_to<unsigned long>;
93 };
94
95 template<typename T> requires EventType<T>
96 struct ParsedEvent {
97 using DataType = T::DataType;
98
99 const str type;
100 const typename T::DataType* data;
101 };
102
103 enum EventStatus {
104 PENDING,
105 PROCESSING,
106 CONSUMED,
107 };
108
109 struct Event {
110 str type;
111 EventStatus status = PENDING;
112 void* ev;
113
114 std::mutex ev_mtx;
115
116 // If it is someone else's job to delete this object
117 bool managed = false;
118
119 template<typename T>
120 requires EventType<T>
121 ParsedEvent<T> parse() {
122 str matchName = T::type;
123 if (matchName == type) {
124 return ParsedEvent<T> {
125 .type = type,
126 .data = (typename T::DataType*) ev,
127 };
128 } else {
129 return ParsedEvent<T> {
130 .type = type,
131 .data = nullptr,
132 };
133 }
134 }
135 };
136
137 void emit_raw(cydui::events::Event* ev);
138
139 void emit_raw(const str &event_type, void* data);
140
141 template<typename T>
142 requires EventType<T>
143 inline void emit(typename T::DataType data) {
144 emit_raw(T::type, new T({.data = data}));
145 }
146
147 template<typename T> requires EventType<T>
148 class Consumer: public std::function<void(const ParsedEvent<T> &)> {
149 public:
150#pragma clang diagnostic push
151#pragma ide diagnostic ignored "google-explicit-constructor"
152
153 Consumer(std::function<void(const ParsedEvent<T> &)> c)
154 : std::function<void(const ParsedEvent<T> &)>(c) {
155 }
156
157#pragma clang diagnostic pop
158 };
159
160
161 typedef std::function<void(Event*)> Listener;
162 struct listener_t;
163
164 void remove_listener(const str &event_type, const listener_t &listener);
165
166 struct listener_t {
167 private:
168 long ID;
169 bool active = true;
170 public:
171 listener_t() {
172 ID = 0;
173 active = false;
174 }
175
176 explicit listener_t(Listener c): func(std::move(c)) {
177 ID = (long) new u8;
178 }
179 //
180 //listener_t(const listener_t &other) {
181 // ID = other.get_id();
182 //}
183
184 [[nodiscard]] long get_id() const {
185 return ID;
186 }
187
188 str event_type;
189 Listener func;
190
191 void remove() {
192 cydui::events::remove_listener(event_type, *this);
193 active = false;
194 }
195
196 bool is_active() const {
197 return active;
198 }
199
200 void operator()(Event* ev) const {
201 func(ev);
202 }
203 };
204
205 listener_t on_event_raw(const str &event_type, const Listener &l);
206
207 template<typename T>
208 requires EventType<T>
209 inline listener_t on_event(Consumer<T> c) {
210 return cydui::events::on_event_raw(T::type, [c](Event* ev) {
211 auto parsed = ev->parse<T>();
212 if (parsed.data) {
213 c(parsed);
214 }
215 });
216 }
217
218
219 void start();
220
221}// namespace cydui::events
222
223// MACROS
224#define consumer [=](it)
225#define listen(EVENT, block) \
226 cydui::events::on_event<EVENT>(cydui::events::Consumer<EVENT>( \
227 [=, this](const cydui::events::ParsedEvent<EVENT>& it) block))
228
229// TODO - In case of event name collision (it's possible), maybe append __FILE__ or __LINE__ to the `type`
230// variable to make the event type unique even if multiple translation units declare similarly named events.
231#define EVENT(NAME, DATA) \
232 struct NAME { \
233 constexpr static const char* type = #NAME; \
234 struct DataType DATA data; \
235 };
